MainClaim.text: "The American Enlightenment was a distinct intellectual movement that shared many ideas with the European Enlightenment

AmericanEnlightenment.text: "American Enlightenment thought was inspired by the ideas of the British and French Enlightenments

ModerateAndRadical.text: "American Enlightenment thought integrated both moderate and radical elements

Chronology.text: "American Enlightenment thought can be appreciated chronologically

DemocracyAndSocialContract.text: "Many European and American Enlightenment figures were critical of democracy

KeyIdeas.text: "At least six ideas came to punctuate American Enlightenment thinking: deism

Deism.text: "Both moderate and radical American Enlightenment thinkers were deists

Liberalism.text: "Liberalism was a central idea in American Enlightenment thought

Conservatism.text: "Conservatism emerged as a reaction to the excesses of the French Revolution

Toleration.text: "Toleration or tolerant pluralism was a major theme in American Enlightenment thought

ScientificProgress.text: "The Enlightenment enthusiasm for scientific discovery was directly related to the growth of deism and skepticism about received religious doctrine."

FourThinkers.text: "Four significant thinkers contributed to the eighteenth-century American Enlightenment: Benjamin Franklin

Franklin.text: "Benjamin Franklin was a key figure in American Enlightenment thought

Madison.text: "James Madison was a key architect of the U.S. Constitution and a prominent thinker in American Enlightenment thought

Legacy.text: "The American Enlightenment project signifies how America has taken a leading role in promoting Enlightenment ideals during the period of modernity
